creditline: Gift of David Tausig Frank and Kazukuni Sugiyama
description: outer carton is cream with tan stripes with dark brown "chops" on it; wooden box with inscriptions; paper under tie; fabric is grey with cream and gold accent; image on a landscape with bridge and figure in LL and building in LR with four lines of inscription in UR corner
inscription:
觀持去意心　獨尋知殊音　日出見山高　月來見水深　風行鳥勻動　天寒魚自沉　靜者無狂念　忘路理可尋
{?}
(Contemplating, grasping the mind with thoughts of departure,
Alone I seek to know extraordinary music.
The sun emerges—one sees the height of the mountains;
The moon arrives—one sees the water\'s depth.
The wind blows—all the birds in motion;
The sky turns cold—fish naturally submerge.
In serenity, with no wild thoughts,
The forgotten path now can be found again.)
[Jonathan Chaves]
signed: %%%%庚辰春日 Spring day in the year 1940
title: Landscape (Spires)
